replies.body: Ouse pads make literally no difference to anything if your playing on a solid surface.
replies.body_tagged: Ouse pads make literally no difference to anything if your playing on a solid surface.

replies.body: Yeah,  that's why I need one. The surface I play is not the best because I play on a laptop, I often don't have it on my desk, and the surface(s) I PVP on may often be dirty.
replies.body_tagged: Yeah,  that's why I need one. The surface I play is not the best because I play on a laptop, I often don't have it on my desk, and the surface(s) I PVP on may often be dirty.

reply_to.body: Ouse pads make literally no difference to anything if your playing on a solid surface.
reply_to.body_tagged: Ouse pads make literally no difference to anything if your playing on a solid surface.

replies.body: I understand if you're playing on a loose surface (bed sheets, sand), but every surface I've played on (glass, an old desktop computer, desks, carpet, bare mattress) all track the same. I guess it also depends on your mouse though.
replies.body_tagged: I understand if you're playing on a loose surface (bed sheets, sand), but every surface I've played on (glass, an old desktop computer, desks, carpet, bare mattress) all track the same. I guess it also depends on your mouse though.

replies.body:
My mouse goes extremely slow on bed sheets :P.
Anyway, I usually play on a table, but it's not the best surtface. It has a bunch of stuff on it and it may also be dirty at times, so a mousepad would do.

replies.body: If you are using a expensive mouse, or a mouse with pads on the bottom, a mouse pad can help you move the mouse faster, and help your mouse last longer.
